Charles F. Reynolds III, M.D., has an extensive clinical background in geriatric psychiatry. After completing his medical degree at Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine and his psychiatry residency at the University of Pittsburgh's Western Psychiatric Institute and Clinic, he became a board-certified psychiatrist with a specialization in geriatric psychiatry.

His clinical work has primarily focused on the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of mood and sleep disorders in older adults. Over the years, he has been involved in various clinical settings, providing direct patient care and working with interdisciplinary teams to address the complex mental health needs of the geriatric population. Dr. Reynolds has also been involved in numerous research projects, with an emphasis on developing and evaluating innovative interventions for late-life mood disorders and sleep problems.

As a professor at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine, Dr. Reynolds has not only contributed to clinical practice but has also played a significant role in training and mentoring the next generation of geriatric psychiatrists.
